website_summaries.verdict: A great mirrorless camera for beginners and pros alike that produces high-quality images and videos.
pros: Shoots up to 11 frames per second
Reasonably priced for what you get
cons: Some users have issues with the camera not recognizing the lens

website_summaries.verdict: Offers a high quality image sensor with tiltable LCD screen and electronic viewfinder.
pros: Includes a large image sensor with 24 megapixels of resolution
Fast performing camera at 11 frames per second in burst mode
Good performance in low light situations
High quality LCD screen that also can tilt away from the camera
Good camera size with the mirrorless design
cons: Kit lens isn't a high quality component

customer_reviews.title: Camera Error. Turn power off then on...
customer_reviews.text: Nice while it worked, but now its worthless with the infuriating message "Camera Error. Turn power off then on." Yep, I tried that and about 100 other suggestions from the thousands of other a6000 owners who experienced the same thing. Still the same unfixable error message. And Sony wants hundreds of $$$$ and several months to fix it. The a6000 was my first and will be my last Sony camera.
customer_reviews.author: N. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Camera Won't Charge
customer_reviews.text: After a few months of minimal use (maybe 200 pictures total taken on camera), I was unable to charge batteries via the AC adapter to the power outlet nor from a USB connection to my laptop. The charging indicator light does not come on. I have tried replacing the batteries and the problem persists. I tried contacting Sony customer support and they provided minimal help outside of recommending that I try using different batteries. This has been very frustrating as I enjoyed the camera quality, but now I cannot charge my batteries through it. The micro USB Port should not brake down like this after such minimal usage. I've only connected the cable to it less than 5 times.
customer_reviews.author: Dominik

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Last Long
customer_reviews.text: You would expect it will last longer than 1.5 years when you paid $600+ for a camera. Mine prompted "Camera Error Turn Power Off Then On" in the middle of vacation and never recover and Sony wants me to pay $200+ to send it for diagnostic minus the parts & labor. Looks like I will never buy Sony ever again and I will make sure all my friends & families stay out of SONY. Stay away or you might have to buy extended warranty for this crappy product.
customer_reviews.author: Jojo Cowan

customer_reviews.title: Great at the right price, and if you buy a good lens
customer_reviews.text: Original a6XXX model camera body. Good buy if you can get body for under $400 or so. Not as many features as newer a6XXX models but still quite adequate for a `serious amateur'. Don't get the crappy 16-50 kit lens! Spend another $500 for the Sony 18-135 lens and you will be very happy with the sharp image at all focal lengths. With that lens the camera is almost `pocket size'. Only detriment is that it does not have silent shutter option like later models. If you need a smaller camera get an RX100.
customer_reviews.author: RV

customer_reviews.title: Pretty disappointed to say the least
customer_reviews.text: The camera took a month to arrive, and when it did, the box had already been opened and the camera put together. All the cords were opened and unwrapped as well. When I switched the camera on, the lens made a strange noise and then a message came on the screen saying that the lens was not connected properly. I reattached the lens multiple times with it clicking firmly into place and it still was not working. Pretty disappointed to say the least. I promptly returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An  open box camera
customer_reviews.text: I’m very disappointed with my purchased. The camera it’s very nice but I’m upset because Amazon gave me a camera that was an open box. It looks like somebody bought it and returned and Amazon gave me that camera. The box was open and the camera and the rest of the stuff that it comes with it was very dusty. Lastly, the memory card it’s missing. I’ll definitely going to send it back.. i wanted to be impressed for the quality of the camera but i was disappointed for the type of camera they send me :(
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Vicente

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality on the camera is okay, but at this price point I expected more. In low light or dim lighting the pictures are pretty bad. I wish I would have talked my husband out of buying this camera. The flash concerns me as well and seems that it can easily break off. It feels cheap to me and the features are basic. It's not worth the almost $500 we paid for it. Spend your money somewhere else, this camera is basic and not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lovz 2 Shop

customer_reviews.title: Camera is fine but No Wireless transfer
customer_reviews.text: The camera works fine but the wireless transfer software are so outdated that moderately updated phones and computers can't use them. And even USB transfer is so clunky as to be practically impossible. Check your model numbers before ordering or find something more user friendly!
customer_reviews.author: krista

customer_reviews.title: If photography is a hobby, this is a great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I can not speak to how professionals would use this camera because i am not one. I use this for video and photos just as a hobby. The focus and clarity really led me to want this camera. Its easy to change the settings and its easy to use. I really dont know that much about cameras. I have had two canons and now this one. This is the best one i have had and dont plan on purchasing a new camera. The only thing i dont like is the battery life, it dies kinda quickly. Other than that i have been pleased and my photos are of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mon Vandy

customer_reviews.title: stopped working in 1 year
customer_reviews.text: almost 1 year to the date the camera won't recognize the lens when it is turned on. Camera took great pictures when it worked but we didn't realize it would have issues so soon.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Good investment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my 6 month trip to Europe this coming year. So far, the picture quality has been very good and very clear. However, I am having trouble getting up close pictures to be in focus. It may just be a setting that I haven’t found yet or maybe I need a different lens for up close pictures. Other than the up close focusing issue, the camera is great for beginners and takes good, quality pictures and videos.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Ptacek

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a review before assuming I received an open box but me being an idiot I jumped to conclusions. Anyway, about the open box situation: I ended up buying a Sony6400 after I returned this one and I noticed it was packaged the same way and kind of does look like it might have been opened before but this is NOT the case. So people bottom line is just because it doesn't have a little piece of tape on it does NOT mean it is an open box. The only reason I am still returning it is because I want a newer version and don't want to be left behind on the technology.
customer_reviews.author: Slavman

customer_reviews.title: nice camera, and some links to more information
customer_reviews.text: Very nice mirrorless camera, esp. for the price. I thought I'd list some resources for others that may be looking; they helped me a great deal. A more detailed a6000 user manual can be found here:  (They used the ILCE-6000 name for this, not sure why, but it makes it harder to find in a search.) There are some decent short videos by Gary Fong on tracking AF. I was able to get it working on the first try after watching that. Here's one:  Like others it would be nice if more lenses were available, but the FE e-mount and APS-C e-mount lenses will both work. There's a nice list here:
customer_reviews.author: Kazooque

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like mine, a LOT! The manual is skimpy at best. Get this to go with it:  I avoided the whole "great kit lens/ terribly soft at all lengths kit lens" debate by buying the body and the Sony SELP18105G E PZ 18-105mm F4 G OSS ( instead. It is what it is, a constant f4 over a very good range and compatible with the full frame if I get one in the future. Now, if I can just get the 70-200mm version . . . . The results of my experiment with battery life using the 18-105mm Power Zoom lens can be found here:
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I've been shooting with this camera for a little over 2 months now and I love it. It's my first DSLR and it's exactly what I was looking for. It's very light and compact and takes beautiful photos, especially for a model that is 6years old. The newer models have better autofocus and better video shooting capabilities but for the price I don't think you can beat the a6000
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Still has great use in 2020
customer_reviews.text: Considering that most people on the web dont have 4k tv's and the human eye can really only see up to 1440dpi it still is completely valid for soo many applications without having to spend 900+. The Lense that comes with it is what it is, however, with the mirrorless and sony emount the right lenses still make this camera amazing in a time where they're running out of actual functions to upgrade at the time. Work's amazing with greenscreen however this is not brought up very much.
customer_reviews.author: Jay asher

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, came with wrong charger
customer_reviews.text: The camera is great but make sure if you are purchasing a bundle (camera case, battery charger, etc) that the added products actually fit the camera. For some reason I was advertised a bundle offer that included this camera, a memory card, camera case, and a battery charger for a battery that doesnt even fit this camera. I trusted that it would fit because why would they offer a charger for a different camera in a bundle? Only after I opened it and looked up the product did I realize the charger is for a completely different camera. Now I'll have to wait several weeks for a refund and correct charger.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Paydon

customer_reviews.title: battery drain issues
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this camera is great, except one thing. This camera has too much power draw when it is turned off in a camera bag. I estimate that a full battery would be completely dead if left in an unused camera for 2 months. I've tried putting the camera in airplane mode and updating the firmware/apps, but the problem is still happening. I have two different genuine Sony batteries. After sitting idle for a few days(or more), whichever one is in the camera will show significantly less than a full charge. The other battery (which has been stored outside of the camera) will retain its full charge and show 100% remaining.
customer_reviews.author: crazyk

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera!!
customer_reviews.text: I own a 5D Mark III and that is my go to for events. However I wanted a camera for hiking that I wouldn't worry as much if it was damaged. I love the size of this camera and the fact it can do anything a dslr camera can. I did sacrifice on the full frame so I have that crop factor. However the quality of the images is very close and I can take waterfall pictures with no issues. Plus I carry a lot less weight around when hiking. The compact carbon fiber Amazon basic tripod is a perfect companion for the avid nature photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Ben C.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, great price
customer_reviews.text: I just took this out for a photoshoot today and I am thoroughly impressed! I'm still learning my way around photography and cameras, but the photos I took turned out professional looking. The camera is compact and light-weight. The lens has plenty of zoom. I'm no expert, but I think this makes a good first camera if you're looking seriously into photography. It has plenty of intelligent assist feature, but you can tweak everything if you'd like also. My only complaint, the battery life is less than stellar. However, from what I've read this is a common issue with mirrorless cameras. They just don't have the room for a larger battery (in comparison to DSLRs).
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality. Bought it for a family trip and ...
customer_reviews.text: Bad quality. Bought it for a family trip and the 3rd day the screen went black. Can't see the menu or the pictures I have taken.
customer_reviews.author: pedro salinas

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera! I started many years ago with the Canon AE-1; I have owned Nikon, Fuji, and several smaller Sony cameras. This one is relatively small, light, and takes great photos -- especially in low light. I have the Sony SELP18105G E PZ 18-105mm F4 G OSS lens which I have used with it to shoot over 100 photos at this point. I have also used it for video -- no overheating problems which I think were solved with a firmware update. Just an amateur, but this camera can make you look like a pro. You can spend a lot more money, but if you're not making money with it it's probably a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Ronupc

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best camera ever! I love this camera. Easy to use and takes excellent pictures (all types). Pros and beginners will love this camera. I was in Utah and was able to take night photos of the stars (from tripod). I've shared one of the night photos, which was taken while pitch black at night. Whale watching action photos from a boat in Maui Hawaii. The shutter speed is second to none for this price point. If you purchase one more camera make it this one. I chose the bundle/kit, which came with the 50mm and 210mm. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Barrow

customer_reviews.title: THE BOMB
customer_reviews.text: I shoot portraits, landscapes, cities, and film videos. I do it all with the a6000. This is an amazing camera for beginners/intermediates or those looking for a compact camera. The kit lens is dope if you provide good light, otherwise it’s a little noisy in low light. Once you upgrade the lens, wow. The only real complaint I have is the batteries die quickly while recording video. Other than that, I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Viktor P

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a DSLR background I wanted to like this step in my photography journey, but it was not meant to be. The biggest drawbacks to me are the poor battery life and overall size of the camera; I have big hands.
customer_reviews.author: Mahu Jedi

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I am a amateur photography user. I bought a timer for my work because I’m required to take a lot of pictures and video. After two years of using a camcorder I finally felt it was time to take the day to buy something better. This was one of the best buys I’ve made the picture quality and video quality is amazing even with my amateur skills. Definitely a great camera for someone’s first starting out to learn.
customer_reviews.author: callie farris

customer_reviews.title: Light small good quality camera
customer_reviews.text: I still have a lot to the learn but the camera has been responsive and has worked exactly as is said it would. Lots of features allow it to do a lot of things.
customer_reviews.author: Codisamus

customer_reviews.title: This is one solid camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mirrorless camera and this one has all the bells and whistles an amateur, and possibly professional, could desire. Perfect fit for an average sized hand. Good weight and balance. This camera seems to be very easy to use and delivers spectacular results, even with the 16-50 mm power zoom lens kit. Just getting started but so far I'm very pleased with the full range of features available. Looking forward to adding additional lenses so I can get even more out of this remarkably versatile camera. Nicely done Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Wells

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera for Price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I missed the sale on the Canon m60. 1. Slow/poor autofocus (can be mitigated by switching the autofocus to a custom button) 2. No external mic support besides a poor quality sony add-on. 3. Decent enough camera for the price, I wish I had purchased something else or waited a bit, found a sony a7iii for the same price lightly used and am kicking my self for not getting it. Takes good clear photos though and would be a great "college" or family vacation camera! All the images are color corrected and then ran through a filter on PicsArt, as we planned to use this for instagram and b-footage.
customer_reviews.author: Keeton Hudson

customer_reviews.title: I prefer my Nikon D3300...
customer_reviews.text: I've tried to take good pictures with this camera and comparing to my Nikon D3300, picture quality just not as good. I recommend looking into another camera.
customer_reviews.author: Eftim Mihov

customer_reviews.title: Easily the best camera i've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best camera i've ever owned. As an amateur photo taker, I've managed to get a lot of amazing shots with less than a year of use. At this time, i'd recommend this camera to anyone who's never owned a more professional camera as a great starting point to see if it's something you'd like to put more money into. I'd highly recommend getting the kit that comes with the longer 200mm kit lens alongside the standard. Attached a few photos i've taken from this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Leith

customer_reviews.title: Nice! So much capability in a small well made package.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my like new a6000 from momentum16 on Amazon Marketplace. The camera is indeed just like new and it even came quickly with a nice leather case. I love being able to use my a6000 with my old 35mm Canon lenses with inexpensive adapters. The Sony computer software and Android apps have worked well and expand the options for use. Picture quality is very good and the video is of high quality. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, couldn't care for the kit lens tho.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, although i believe mine was defective. Will definitely be buying another one in the coming months! Took great shots when it did work, the AF is really fast and accurate. I do not like the kits lens to much and when i buy this product again i will just buy the body. Another thing i didnt really like is the file is ARW type which my first time encountering this file and nothing i had supported it. Quick fix tho just google ARW drivers and you'll be set for viewing photos and being able to edit them with Photoshop. Hope this review helped some of you guys.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew G.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great semi-professional camera, but remember, it's not the camera that has to be great, it's you. Don't buy this if you think this will just provide you good images. You have to provide the good image. Do buy this if you have done research and know how to handle the level of control this camera allows.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Hall

customer_reviews.title: my experience with this produce below average
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would be nicest buy of the holidays. to my surprise ever thing about this purchase purely bad. including return.! good bye sony.
customer_reviews.author: tech geek

customer_reviews.title: A FINE CAMERA BUT A STEEP LEARNING CURVE
customer_reviews.text: A WONDERFUL CAMERA THAT GIVES SPLENDID RESULTS. HOWEVER THE PROBLEM IS THAT THE BOOKLET OF DIRECTIONS IS TERRIBLE AND I HAD TO GO TO A CAMERA EXPERT TO LEARN HOW TO PROGRAM IT. WHY DOESN'T SONY INCLUDE A USEFUL AND HELPFUL BOOKLET THAT TELLS HOW TO MAKE THE VARIOUS SETTINGS AND AVOID THE WASTED TIME MASTERING A STEEP LEARNING CURVE.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES MULVEY

customer_reviews.title: Camera is almost 2 years old and the view screen ...
customer_reviews.text: Camera is almost 2 years old and the view screen and view finder will not work they are just black. One minute it was working the next it wasn't. Also the camera will not turn on unless you remove the battery and place it back in the camera then turn it on. For a $600 camera that hasn't been dropped or used that much its very disappointing. Read reviews outside of Amazon there are a lot of issues with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought refurbish so I was sort of setting myself up for failure. Camera came with lens attached. As soon as camera turns on it’s blurry and says lens isn’t properly attached. After reading the manual, talking to the manufacturer and troubleshooting and enabling camera functions, camera still does not work properly. I’m extremely disappointed in product and quality, especially considering the price I paid even for a refurbished item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I will be traveling and we needed a camera. My daughter recommended this one, she also has it and is very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: DeliGirlgood

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Camera broke after 5 months routine use- fails to save images. All in all, I’m hopeful for a refund and not a fix - I miss my zoom and was overly challenged by the controls. I believe I can capture same quality of images by refined, advanced point and shoots.
customer_reviews.author: mike f

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for about a year and a half so far. It's a good camera for beginner photographers as it's easy to learn to use. The pictures generally don't need editing and are clear and bright. It's quite a change from the digital we had before that was much cheaper, or our phone cameras. I wish the battery lasted a little longer and it did better in dark lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera, bought it right before we went to Disney along with a 32gb Lexar class II SD Card. Both performed above my expectations, from low light conditions to video I was very impressed. The battery life was better than expected, I was expecting the juice to run out after a few hours of use but I was able to take a couple of hundred pictures every day along with 10 to 20 minutes of video every day without any problems. I would definitely recommend this camera to anybody. I only wish they had a string on the lens cap other than that this camera is awesome and outperforms anything else I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Miller

customer_reviews.title: Fast power on and picture acquisition pics look amazing!
customer_reviews.text: What to say that hasn't been said, I chose this over my full sized DSLR for a hike through Europe to save weight and space, it has stunning image quality I'm very impressed! I can turn it on, take a picture and turn it off to keep moving fast I kept the kit lens on instead of using the heavier manual focus wide angle and happy I did.
customer_reviews.author: Ballzdeep

customer_reviews.title: This is a really nice camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: I only use this for video (a lot of livestreaming), and for $500 this is an amazing camera. The video quality is higher than its price point would suggest. Overall I'm quite pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Walling

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Nex-7 with this one, and I am loving it. The autofocus is extremely fast, and the focus tracking is impresive. For example, I was able to take sharp pictures to a flying hawk indoors on a show, that was amazing. It has lots of customizable options, so you have to study a bit the manual, but once you get it, it is a great camera, very fast to use, and with the compact power zoom, it is really pocketable. I have bought also the 50mm f.8 and the 35mm f.18 which are both great, and the 55-210 mm zoom that is the perfect complement for the 16-50mm kit zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a nice camera to travel and start taking amateur photos with. At first I was looking at the usual mid range Canon and Nikon DSLRs but I came across this and it was exactly what I wanted. I read up on this camera for a few days before deciding to buy it and I couldn't be more satisfied with my purchase. The A6000 is a very good camera that has many features, is easy to navigate, and isn't as bulky of a camera as a DSLR to carry around. There are also a wide variety of lenses to choose from.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: The focus and clarity is amazing, and the shutter speed is crazy fast
customer_reviews.text: Switched from a Canon DSLR to this Sony A6000 and was blown away. The focus and clarity is amazing, and the shutter speed is crazy fast. I'm now selling all my Canon gear (even my L-lenses) and won't be missing them at all. There hasn't been a single shot I need that I can't pull off with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: T. Dreyer

customer_reviews.title: but liked the idea of it being smaller than a SLR
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a real camera again instead of using my phone or a point and shoot. I was hesitant about getting a mirrorless, but liked the idea of it being smaller than a SLR. My friend who is a professional photographer recommended this and I'm happy he did. It's compact and takes amazing photos. My only gripe, and not a big enough one to remove a star, is that it takes 5 hours to charge the battery but only three to drain it (turn it off when not using it). You will need to a buy a second battery and they are expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: No lens hood + the most uncomfortable shoulder strap ever.
customer_reviews.text: Takes excellent photos and is a great camera, but Sony obviously invested $0.02 in the most uncomfortable, cheap shoulder-strap they could have possibly made. So I would suggest you upgrade and buy another strap if you are going to buy this camera. Also, it's pretty absurd that the 16-50 mm lens does not come with a lens hood. And apparently, Sony does not make one. That is just ridiculous to me as I am finding it very hard to find one with solid positive reviews and will either have to buy a new lens that comes with one or just buy one of the cheap hoods from a third-party.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J

customer_reviews.title: but this one has made it really easy to get into
customer_reviews.text: I am a novice with cameras, but this one has made it really easy to get into. Great features, quick focus, and hassle-free controls make it a nice first camera. The only drawback for me (and it wouldn't be for someone with more experience ) is the lack of zoom. You really need to purchase a separate lens for close ups if you plan on using it for sports and other performances. Other then that it has been an awesome camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: I will say that it's a very good camera but way over my head as a novice. A year later and I still don't know what half the features are.....not for beginners in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... for 1 year now and I can't say enough good things! I was so worried intally about such ...
customer_reviews.text: We've had this camera for 1 year now and I can't say enough good things! I was so worried intally about such a big purchase but I honk we made the best decision for us! We like that it's lightweight being mirrorless vs DSLR. The functions are so easy to use, it's intuitive. The photos turn out fantastic. We mainly use it for travel and backyard/home family memories.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Still the best!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this camera and can't find any reason to upgrade after years of use!
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Great travel camera
customer_reviews.text: Takes great clear shots with a minimum of camera weight and fuss. One drawback is that if you shoot in low light, there is a delay while the camera processes the image before you can take your next shot. You can address this by using a multi-shot mode when necessary. I got it with a 16-50 mm which is good for general use, and a 55 -210 which worked extremely well for long-distance wildlife photos on safari. I am an enthusiastic amateur and don't use a lot of the more sophisticated features, but was very happy with the photos.
customer_reviews.author: Vermonter

customer_reviews.title: Great Place to Start
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes fantastic pictures, and for someone looking for a good starting point for mirrorless cameras this is probably the perfect camera. It's got loads of features but does a great job on the automatic setting as well. This is a no brainer compared to a point and shoot with a permanent lens. I purchased this to take better pictures of friends and family than the sort of just OK stuff we were all getting with our phones. I want to remember family events with great detail and maybe be able to capture frameable snapshots and a cellphone CMOS just doesn't cut it most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Really nice upgrade from a dSLR...
customer_reviews.text: Still in progress on getting used to this bad boy coming from a Nikon dSLR. First, the picture quality is outstanding with the stock lens. Compared to my Nikon, the size is amazing too. I think it is pocketable in cargo shorts with a pancake lens. The on-to-shoot time is a little slower than your average dSLR, but the autofocus is much faster and works fantastically. Definitely like a point and shoot, but with an image quality that rivals anything I've seen as a prosumer. Will update when I get a f2.8 prime lens and monkey with the macro settings more.
customer_reviews.author: Bret Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Its Sony of course its one of the best!
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far. Has quite a learning curve if you dont know anything about photography. Get the 26 dollar book from the expert I forgot his name but it has everything you need to know about the camera easily explained. Also the Sigma 30mm 1.4 is a great prime lens for it. Lots to learn but its an amazing camera!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I had purchased a canon T6 and after a bit more research, I had determined the Sony A6000's capabilities were better suited for my needs. The pictures are great and for my work the video is freaking awesome. I look forward to growing my Sony gear. Great thing is full-frame lenses work on this one so if you purchase them as you upgrade all your lenses will work as you upgrade your camera body.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Sony
customer_reviews.text: I would say it’s a solid camera. Only complaints are the quality of the lcd screen and difficult to use controls. Their is a shallow learning curve and the screen doesn’t accurately reflect what your photos will look like.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Morfin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great picture too.
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera, got the zoom lens to go with it and took it to Europe for vacation. Unbelievable clarity in all sorts of conditions. Cruise ship to busses to taxi's and walking and walking and walking.........not too heavey and bulky as others are. quick enough to shoot on the fly. and I can crop out peoples heads and still have a great shot.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Killer auto focus
customer_reviews.text: This camera has great auto focus. It’s overall a great camera. One star off for not having the flip out screen. Not good for vlogging. Nice build, nice image quality. First Sony camera I’ve owned in a while.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Jax

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Photo quality was not what I expected, esp. in low light.
customer_reviews.author: D. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: I love this little camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this little camera. A great form-factor that is wonderful for taking on a day hike and excellent image quality. The lens detaches with solid action and the interface for the various knobs is very customizable by the user. Get a quality strap like BlackRapid though because the included strap is not very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: CEOofEncom

customer_reviews.title: Sticking to Sony for cameras!
customer_reviews.text: New to photography and this camera made the introduction so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Metal Icarus

customer_reviews.title: This camera take beautiful photos. Especially outdoors
customer_reviews.text: This camera take beautiful photos. Especially outdoors. I’ve attached two cropped photos. With absolutely no photo editing. Just taken as is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon shopper 85

customer_reviews.title: Best quality for the current price
customer_reviews.text: I tried Nikon and Canon at this price point of around $400.. And settled on the Sony due to overall ease of use and size, and quality. If the battery life was better, it would be nearly perfect. Save yourself the time and go for this one instead of a $500 kit Nikon kit from Target or Costco.
customer_reviews.author: happycamper

customer_reviews.title: Grear product for an on-the-go person
customer_reviews.text: If you're not overly into tech, but want to take nice pictures, this does the job well. My girlfriend really likes it, and it is a lot easier to use than my larger DSLR. The quality of photos shines, it focuses quickly, and action shots stay in focus really reall well. A must with our active kids.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: A great camera for a reasonable price that could have been ...
customer_reviews.text: A great camera for a reasonable price that could have been better. PROS -price -build quality -Focus speed, accuracy -very fast continuous shooting -resolution -light, and grip is great -fun to use CONS -some buttons are in weird places -no headphone jack -some presets are a bit weird -battery life is bad (keep in mind that is a common issue with mirror less cameras) In conclusion I like it and it fit my personal needs If you can afford it and it fits what you need out of a camera 4 out 5 times you will be very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Will C.H.

customer_reviews.title: Ideal Starter Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is one​ amazing camera. After doing tons of research I decided to take the plunge and get it. For someone just getting into photography it is ideal starter camera. I took a few shots, mind you I am a total newbie and still learning so much, and really was pleased so far. Very light weight and will be a breeze to take backpacking/hiking.
customer_reviews.author: S. FrostTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Feeling lucky!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this camera. I wasn't really a big picture taking kind of person, but since I've bought this camera, I've also bought a tripod, additional lenses, and even books to learn a little bit more about photography. It's all because this camera is extremely amazing and makes you want to learn as much as possible about taking perfect pictures. I hadn't really done an extreme amount of research prior to buying this. I bought it based on very little research and the reviews from this page. I made the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Alton

customer_reviews.title: Great begginer camera
customer_reviews.text: No in body image stabilization but Sony does offer lenses with this feature. So far a great little camera for a begginer photographer.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ramos

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I took this on my trip to Europe and it took amazing pictures and was super nice and compact! I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone traveling or just looking for a nice light camera that takes pretty good pictures
customer_reviews.author: Marsha

customer_reviews.title: My first camera
customer_reviews.text: I like the camera Take nice pictures Eze to use Eze to carry I like My camera Only I need more lenses to take real state pictures Fish I Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Eddy

customer_reviews.title: As good as my Nikon d7000
customer_reviews.text: Pictures were crystal clear at 24 megapixels. As good as my Nikon d7000. It was easy to transport in my backpack just in case I would need it at a moments notice. You have to have a high capacityy SD card to be able to keep up with the fantastic features this camera offers. The WiFi is a great addition to the vast array of features on this camera, and allows the user to share important moments immediately with friends and family. A great little power house when it comes to capturing and editing your special,moments in pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis  Harasty

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on this camera
customer_reviews.text: Great deal on this camera! I'm back into photography after a many year absence and while I'm traveling this will be very easy to carry. The other cameras out there feel like you're carrying a heavy softball in your hand all the time. This thing easily slips into my pocket if I need to. Check out the YouTube videos on this camera. There are many.
customer_reviews.author: ab

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS CAMERA!!  YOU WILL BE SO GLAD YOU DID.
customer_reviews.text: The greatest camera I've ever had. Has instructions on the LCD SCREEN,don't have to take the tripod mount off to change batteries. Has 3'' tilting LCD screen. Thought about buying 2 for when the first one had to be retired for whatever reason. Takes the most beautiful pictures, sharp, clear, vivid colors that I'm amazed with. Makes me feel like a photographer (which I'm really not by any stretch). SONY done it up right on this one, Would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: close2right

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Great in general. Sometimes reports a problem with lens recognition when turning off-on quickly (with original set lens), corrects after off-on again. Battery cover opens accidentally easy. Problem with web interface software out of USA.
customer_reviews.author: David CR

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a pro by any means, but this camera is amazing! It's fast, has good ISO and the image stabilization in the lens is great. You can take long exposure shots without a tripod. I've done 3 second exposures by hand, that's crazy! The battery life is horrible though. Get a set of battery's and a wall charger. Wasabi makes a set that seems to work well for pretty cheap. And get a huge memory card, the camera is fast (lots of pictures will be taken) and if you are shooting raw, it will fill up fast.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Baird

customer_reviews.title: I am in love with this camera
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this camera. I do video work on the side and this device has been my bread and butter. In combination with the Sony E 55-120mm lense I'm set. The kit lense works absolutely fine in most videos I take and the auto focus is quick and accurate. Honestly, why buy a huge DSLR when this camera takes pictures just as good and is something small enough you will actually carry with you.
customer_reviews.author: Blaze

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great picture and video quality. Battery life has a lot to be desired
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for beginner to intermediate photographers looking to sharpen skills. Kit lens is a great starter lens. Very compact. Shoots good video. Battery life is one of the only drawbacks. Just get extra. That being said this is a great camera!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Knight

customer_reviews.title: great camera for the price range and for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I am an absolute beginner when it comes to photography and bought my Sony A6000 about a month ago to practice and develop my skills. It is a neatly designed and versatile product that is easy to carry and is a perfect companion for someone starting out with photography. it takes Beautiful pictures and great video at 1080p 60fps, easy to use, a awesome auto-focus, easy menu handling, and ok battery. but dont let that put you off from buying it. its a overall great camera. Especially when this camera is 4 years old this camera is still relevant in 2018
customer_reviews.author: alan perez

customer_reviews.title: awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: As I figured this camera went way beyond my expectations. It could be used to do weddings product photography anything. Took some pictures of my grand kids and they were gorgeous
customer_reviews.author: Sidney

customer_reviews.title: Great portable all-around camera
customer_reviews.text: Nice little camera for my daughter as Christmas present. Coming from Canon 70D, I wasn't expecting much from this, but was pleasantly surprised. Picture quality is good even with the kit lens. The wireless transfer of pictures to phones is nice, although far from perfect. One nice thing compared to the 70D is the faster live shot mode. There doesn't seem to be much penalty compared to using the view finder. With Canon, I would miss shots if not using the viewfinder.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lian

customer_reviews.title: Pocketable DSLR Revival
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this camera for a month now and absolutely love it!I am a hobbiest photographer and by no means a professional. I switched from a Nikon D7000 and have no regrets. I am a huge fan of the compact size, optical viewfinder (OFV) and incredibly fast autofocus. Pair the A6000 with the SEL-20F28 and you have a pocketable high end camera! I would hight recommend this camera for anyone looking for a small, high-end camera system that rivals most DSLRs.
customer_reviews.author: TruthPaste

customer_reviews.title: Amazing photos
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a trip to Japan and I am so glad I did. I’m not a pro photographer and this camera has options that work for a layperson but still take great photos. And if you are a seasoned photographer this camera also has more advanced settings.
customer_reviews.author: Pamplemousse

customer_reviews.title: The image quality.
customer_reviews.text: The adittional lenses Sony make, are very expensives. The original zoom lens is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Joao B.

customer_reviews.title: Best in price range.
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. I am a newbie when it comes to the world of photography. This was my step up from phone and point n shoot cameras. I have to say, this camera is such an easy transition. It's full auto features are great, but easy to get used to full manual control. Experience from friends that own Nikon or Canon in the same price range, Sony wins for speed, compact, ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this camera.
customer_reviews.text: Really great for on the go shots, light and easy to carry around and you can choose what quality of images you can take. Wifi function for sending photos directly to phone is very helpful as well, I use the app ImagingEdgeMobile to transfer my photos.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great ILC Camera.
customer_reviews.text: This is an exceptionally nice camera. The picture quality is quite good. The directions are a little mysterious, so I am still on the learning curve. But I have already taken some exceptionally sharp pictures and love the feel of the camera. I think it will become my favorite. I think the pictures might be a little more sharp than my old Nikon 1, although that is a very good option for people to consider as well.
customer_reviews.author: Fred L. Rasp

customer_reviews.title: Really nice camera. Lots of functionality
customer_reviews.text: Really nice camera. Lots of functionality. Great pictures. First one quite working after 30 minutes of use. Amazon had me a full replacement in two days, at my door, return of the original paid. That is significantly more convenient than it would have been had I bought it through brick and mortar. I like Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: B D

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this camera
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this camera. I've been looking for a more compact alternative to my Canon 5D for every day family photos. I had high expectations since I usually shoot with a DSLR but this camera is great!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from my old DSLR.
customer_reviews.text: I was using a Sony alpha 300 from 2008 or so. This is an celebrate upgrade. The auto-focus is very quick and I can fire off shots very quickly. I use my finger to hold the flash towards the ceiling, which then works great as a bounce flash. Also, if I wear cargo shorts I can fit the camera in my pocket. I have been very happy with the kit lens as well. If you want better, add the Zeiss prime lens.
customer_reviews.author: txaggies07

customer_reviews.title: Incredible quality, small design.
customer_reviews.text: This series of camera has proven itself to be dependable and of great quality. The only thing I find lacking is that the lens does not have a mf ring. That function lies within the camera itself so that is just a matter of personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph K Rykse

customer_reviews.title: Having "writing to the memory card was not completed correctly" when recording video
customer_reviews.text: After about a year use, it starts having "writing to the memory card was not completed correctly" when recording video. It will start recording, but about about 45 seconds or 1 min, it goes to a black screen and showing the error. Never be not recover the video after press "Enter" to resume.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent image quality on both photos and video
customer_reviews.text: 3 years after its release and this camera is still relevant! excellent image quality on both photos and video. hint. shoot raw with this camera and the editing experience is amazing! shoot avchd or xavc s video the this camera and you get tack sharp videos!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Hubby loves it
customer_reviews.text: I really can't do a proper review of this as I got it for my husband. Many have given a great review which helped me decide. He loves the camera. He finds the on-screen explanations very helpful. The photo quality seems very superior. He can crop a very small area of a shot and the resulting cropped area looks perfect. At the time of purchase, Amazon was running a great deal on getting a bundle (the camera and another lens). All I had to add was an SD card and a carrying bag.
customer_reviews.author: A RHEA

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality camera
customer_reviews.text: First camera I’ve ever bought. I do not have any regrets. Also no negative remarks. Not exactly what I was expecting, but I do reccomend!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! Moved up from a canon rebel T5 and could not be more pleased with the Sony A6000. Starting to wish I had sprung for the A6300 because of the mic jack but this is working wonderfully for vlogging, with the fast auto focus and face tracking. I also use it for city photography and outdoor/hiking, all of these generally done at night. Really a wide range of use. Would recommend this to anyone looking to step up from a beginner dslr but still on a budget. Note- Kit lens, Like most cameras is not great. I have sense started using a canon 10-18mm lens as i prefer wide angle shots and videos
customer_reviews.author: stephen rocha

customer_reviews.title: note: just a minor screen tilt, not flip screen
customer_reviews.text: My only disappointment is that the camera screen doesn't tilt enough to be able to see yourself while taking a photo. Our previous camera had the flip screen which was the best for taking a quick group pic on the go. This screen tilts but only enough to benefit someone using a tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Peltier

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera for people getting into photography
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm loving the Sony a6000. This is the first camera I have owned and it has been great to use so far. I mainly take landscapes and it has been great even with just the kit lens. I also bought the Sigma 16mm for astrophotography. If you are looking for a good first camera I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

product_meta.title: Sony Alpha a6000 Mirrorless Digital Camera 24.3MP SLR Camera with 3.0-Inch LCD (Black) w/16-50mm Power Zoom Lens
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:w/ 16-50mm| Configuration:Base79 point focal plane phase detection AF sensor. The compact, lightweight camera delivers superb image quality via newly developed 24.3 effective megapixel (approx.) Exmor APS HD CMOS sensor and BIONZ X image processing engine as well as highly intuitive operation thanks to an OLED Tru Finder and two operation dials.
feature_bullets: Advanced 24.2MP back Illuminated 35 millimeter full frame image sensor
ISO 100 25600 (expandable to 51200). Lens compatibility: Sony E mount lenses
Hybrid AF with 179 point focal plane phase detection and 25 contrast detect points
Up to 11 FPS continuous shooting. Battery Life (Still Images): Up to 360 shots. Metering type:1200-zone evaluative metering
3 inch tilting LCD with 921,000 dots. Viewfinder Type: 0.39 in type electronic viewfinder (color)
In the box: Rechargeable Battery NP FW50; Shoulder strap; Eyepiece cup; Micro USB cable
Anti-dust system: Charge protection coating on optical filter and ultrasonic vibration mechanism

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,036 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
